question_sentence: According to a newly published study, British parents increasingly view what as socially acceptable?
choices: Taking schoolchildren on holiday during term time
evidence: Research by Public First found that parental attitudes to school attendance had undergone a "seismic shift" since the pandemic. According to the consultancy firm, term-time holidays are increasingly viewed as "socially acceptable", as price hikes make summer breaks unaffordable for families hit by the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: A priest was accused of desecration after he set up what in a 600-year-old church in Cornwall?
evidence: Rev Dr Nick Widdows defended the decision to install a mini bar in St Ia's Church ahead of the town’s annual September festival, saying that “this is just part of our way of welcoming all sorts of people into the church”. For more odd new stories, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Who ended Max Verstappen’s 10-race winning streak by claiming victory at the Singapore Grand Prix?
evidence: The Spanish racing ace claimed victory for Ferrari by narrowly beating his close friend and former McLaren teammate Norris to the finish line in the streets of Singapore on Sunday. Verstappen trailed in fifth position, behind Leclerc and Hamilton.

question_sentence: British Vogue editor-in-chief Edward Enninful will be replaced by who after stepping down next year?
evidence: Following months of speculation, Condé Nast has confirmed that London-born Nnadi, currently editor of the US Vogue website, will take the reins of the UK magazine from next March. The 44-year-old will be the publication’s first black female editor.

question_sentence: Which national leader claimed the UN was “losing credibility” as the intergovernmental organisation’s annual assembly kicked off in New York City?
evidence: Ireland's president took aim at the UN as political leaders including his taoiseach, Leo Varadkar, gathered in New York for the organisation’s 2023 General Assembly. The annual event got under way on Tuesday with an address from Joe Biden, but the leaders of the other four veto-wielding, permanent members of the UN Security Council – Britain, France, Russia and China – were conspicuously absent.

question_sentence: The total number of women on this year’s Booker Prize shortlist is fewer than the tally of male nominees who share which first name?
evidence: Paul Harding, Paul Lynch and Paul Murray are among six authors nominated for Britain’s top literary prize. Jonathan Escoffery is also a finalist, with only two women on the shortlist, Sarah Bernstein and Chetna Maroo.

question_sentence: Newly released Metropolitan Police figures show that one in every how many officers in the force are currently suspended or on restricted duties?
evidence: The Met has a total of around 34,000 officers, 201 of whom are suspended, while 860 are on restricted duties. The London force said that 450 officers were under investigation for alleged sexual or domestic violence, and that 275 were already awaiting gross misconduct hearings, amid a crackdown on rogue officers.

question_sentence: Latest polling suggests that Labour and the Tories are "neck and neck" in the upcoming by-election in which constituency?
evidence: The Survation poll, commissioned by the Labour Together group, found that the Labour and Conservative candidates for the previously safe Tory seat were level-pegging on 29% each. But pundits said that with the Lib Dems candidate on 22%, a split “progressive” vote could spell victory for the Tories in the October by-election, which was triggered by the resignation of Nadine Dorries.

question_sentence: Which car company has publicly criticised Rishi Sunak’s decision to delay the UK’s 2030 ban on new petrol and diesel cars?
evidence: The company’s UK chair, Lisa Brankin, said the 2030 target had been a "vital catalyst to accelerate Ford into a cleaner future“. Pushing back the non-electric car ban to 2035 would “undermine” the government’s “ambition, commitment and consistency”, Brankin warned.

question_sentence: An activist is to be prosecuted for contempt of court for holding up a sign outside the trial of protesters from which climate group?
evidence: Civil liberties campaigners said the decision to prosecute retired social worker Trudi Warner for holding up a sign allegedly directed at jurors was part of the government's crackdown on the right to protest. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: According to a newly published study, British parents increasingly view what as socially acceptable?
choices: Taking schoolchildren on holiday during term time

question_sentence: Which group of unionized employees walked off their jobs recently in an unprecedented strike?
evidence: Thousands of autoworkers are on strike against General Motors, Ford and Stellantis — which makes cars under the Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep and Ram brands. It is the first time in history that the United Auto Workers union has struck all of America’s Big Three automakers at the same time.

question_sentence: Which Republican presidential candidate said he plans to skip the second GOP primary debate in California?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump, who skipped the first Republican presidential primary debate, will also skip the second debate next Wednesday and instead will travel to Detroit to deliver a speech to union workers. Like the first debate, the other GOP candidates must meet certain donor and polling thresholds to make the debate stage.

question_sentence: Which product in the US recently climbed to its highest price of the year?
evidence: Gas prices increased to their highest level of the year on Monday to $3.88 a gallon, according to AAA. Eleven states are averaging $4 or higher a gallon, and in California, the price is now $5.80 a gallon.

question_sentence: World leaders gathered at the annual United Nations General Assembly summit this week. Where is the UN headquartered?
evidence: The United Nations is headquartered in New York City. On Tuesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky made his first in-person address to the UN General Assembly since Russia invaded his country.

question_sentence: The US government is relaunching a program that will provide which item to American households at no expense?
evidence: US households will be able to order up to four free Covid-19 tests starting Monday.

question_sentence: Approximately how many refugees have been admitted to the US this year?
evidence: More than 50,000 refugees have been admitted to the US this year, according to the latest federal data. President Biden has set this year’s refugee ceiling at 125,000 and is considering raising the number of refugees who could be admitted to the US next year.

question_sentence: The US made a deal with which country to free five wrongfully detained Americans?
evidence: Five Americans were released from Iranian detention in a wider deal to unfreeze $6 billion in Iranian funds.

question_sentence: Which animal made an unexpected appearance at Disney World this week, prompting the temporary closure of several rides?
evidence: A bear that prompted partial closures at Walt Disney World’s Magic Kingdom on Monday was captured without incident and is being relocated.

question_sentence: Which country may be officially changing its name?
evidence: Various media outlets are reporting that India’s Modi government may soon put forward a resolution to officially change the country’s name to Bharat.

question_sentence: Archaeologists recently unearthed the oldest known structure in the world. Which material was it made of?
evidence: This simple wooden structure found along a riverbank in Zambia is almost half a million years old, researchers say.

question_sentence: What was the final selling price of the N.C. Wyeth painting "Ramona" that was purchased for $4 from a thrift store?
Where will the annual Punkin Chunkin World Championship be held this year?
Why did ShopRite stores in Delaware return to full-service checkout with cashiers?
choices: Because they wanted to speed up the checkout process.
Because they experienced a labor shortage.

question_sentence: What is the main theme of Rockwood's upcoming event, the "Goth Ball: A Night at Rockwood"?
choices: An art exhibition at the Biggs Museum

question_sentence: Who did Governor John Carney endorse for the next Delaware governor in 2024?
What inspired Joshua Sheppard to raise donations for Sean's Room at Saint Mark's High School?
choices: The story of Sean Locke and the SL24 Foundation

question_sentence: Which ranking did Delaware State University achieve in the 2023 U.S. News and World Report rankings for HBCUs?
What is the primary focus of the Brandywine River Restoration Trust's mission?
choices: Promoting local sources of water and tap water
Cleaning up water in the Brandywine and educating underserved communities about contaminated water
Analyzing rainfall data for real-time updates on river water quality

question_sentence: What has concerned residents about Noramco's expansion plans?
choices: The company's intention to reduce emissions
The potential release of toxic compounds and hazardous pollution
The lack of response from the Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control (DNREC)
The absence of the environmental justice coordinator

question_sentence: Why was the woman in the story first put in prison?
choices: She was convicted of multiple crimes.
She refused to cooperate with the court's attempts to help her.
She had a lengthy criminal record in other states.
She violated the terms of her no-contact order.
